title: Plaid Maxi Skirts, Chuck Taylors and Lots of Layering Took Over Street Style at Camp Flog Gnaw 2024

html:
• Home
  • Style

Tyler, The Creator's Los Angeles festival brought just as much inspiring fashion as it did great music.

Photos: Brooke Frischer/Fashionista

Tyler, The Creator's Los Angeles festival brought just as much inspiring fashion as it did great music.

Tyler, The Creator's annual musical curation Camp Flog Gnaw closed out the year in festivals on Sunday night in Los Angeles, featuring artists like Doechii, Playboi Carti, Omar Apollo, Raye and more. Though the event takes place outside of the regular summer concert circuit, the Californian showgoers didn't let the November chill compromise their dressing abilities.

Festival staples like bohemian flowy linens, crochet tops, chunky chain belts and head scarves were present throughout the weekend. To better prepare for the desert chill, though, guests incorporated lots of masterful layering into their looks, wearing layers of knit sweaters and one-of-a-kind jackets. To keep the bottom halves of their bodies warm, many reached for a grunge-meets-preppy plaid maxi skirt, sometimes laid over a pair of pants.

The most popular footwear of the festival was undoubtedly Converse, particularly Tyler, The Creator's latest collaboration, the Golf le Fleur x Darryl Chuck 70. Beyond the new colorful low-top sneakers with oversized laces, fans embraced the brand's recently revived, Y2K-beloved knee-high silhouette, high-top frayed cotton Isabel Marant styles, platformed Run Star Hikes and more. 

Though over 40 artists played the festival, fans focused on embodying founder and headliner Tyler, The Creator, with many wearing furry hats, full suits, ties and sweater vests — all signature elements of his personal style.
